item.title: Ben Nevis Hike: Saturday, 19th July 2025
item.dc:creator: Linus Chirchir
item.description:
Ben Nevis Hiking Trip via Mountain Track from Fort William

Take on the highest mountain in the UK. Join us for an unforgettable summer hiking challenge as we summit Ben Nevis (1,345 m / 4,413 ft), one of Scotland’s most iconic peaks.

🗓️ Date

Saturday, 19th July 2025

📍 Location

Meeting Point: Usher Hall, Edinburgh
Time: Departure to for the Mountain Path at 4:00 AM

🏞️ About Ben Nevis

Located near the town of Fort William in the Scottish Highlands, Ben Nevis is a magnet for hikers and mountaineers. The trail offers breathtaking views, rugged beauty, and a true sense of accomplishment.

🥾 Hike Overview

  • Route: Mountain Track (also known as the Tourist Route)
  • Distance: ~17 km round trip
  • Elevation Gain: ~1,350 meters
  • Difficulty: Strenuous
  • Estimated Duration: 7–9 hours

🎒 What to Bring

  • Sturdy hiking boots
  • Weather-appropriate clothing (layers, waterproofs)
  • Plenty of water and snacks
  • Sun protection and personal first aid kit
  • Trekking poles (optional but helpful)

⚠️ Important Notes

  • Weather in the Highlands can change rapidly. Be prepared for rain, wind, or fog.
  • This hike is physically demanding — a good fitness level is required.
  • Children under 16 must be accompanied by a responsible adult.

🚗 Travel

Participants are encouraged to arrange carpooling. Let us know in advance if you can offer or need a lift.

📝 Register

Interested in joining? Please contact us or fill out the Volunteer form and mention Ben Nevis Hike in the message.

Let’s summit the UK’s tallest mountain together!

item.title: Pentland Hills Hike: Saturday, 28 June 2025
item.dc:creator: Linus Chirchir
item.description:
Pentland Hills Circular Walk from Flotterstone

Join us for a rejuvenating summer day out in the Pentland Hills Regional Park. This circular walk from Flotterstone offers panoramic views, peaceful trails, and a wonderful opportunity to connect with nature and fellow community members.

🗓️ Date

Saturday, 28th June 2025

📍 Location

Meeting Point: Usher Hall, Edinburgh
Time: Meet at 7:00 AM for a prompt 7:15 AM departure

🥾 Walk Overview

  • Route: Circular trail via Turnhouse Hill and Carnethy Hill
  • Distance: ~11 km / 7 miles
  • Elevation Gain: ~550 meters
  • Highest Points:
    • Turnhouse Hill – 506 m / 1,660 ft
    • Carnethy Hill – 573 m / 1,880 ft
  • Difficulty: Moderate
  • Estimated Duration: 3.5–4.5 hours (including breaks and photo stops)

This hike is suitable for individuals with a basic to moderate fitness level and includes a mix of steady climbs, rolling hills, and stunning views across Edinburgh and Midlothian.

🎒 What to Bring

  • Comfortable hiking boots or sturdy walking shoes
  • Layered clothing and waterproof outerwear
  • Water and packed lunch/snacks
  • Sunscreen and a sunhat
  • Camera or phone for photos
  • A friendly smile and adventurous spirit!

🚗 Getting There

  • By car: Free parking is available at the Flotterstone Car Park
  • By bus: Lothian Buses 101/102 serve the nearby area

Let us know if you’d like to carpool—we’ll do our best to help coordinate rides.

📝 Register

Interested in joining us?
👉 Sign up through the Volunteer form and mention “Pentlands Hike” in the message section.
Or feel free to email us.

We look forward to walking the Pentlands with you!

item.title: Glas Tulaichean & Càrn Hike: Saturday, 21 June 2025
item.dc:creator: Linus Chirchir
item.description:
Glas Tulaichean & Càrn an Rìgh Hiking Trip from Spittal of Glenshee

Join us for a breathtaking summer hiking adventure as we summit two iconic Munros, Glas Tulaichean (1,051 m / 3,448 ft)** and Càrn an Rìgh (1,029 m / 3,376 ft) both in the heart of the scenic Glenshee Highlands.

🗓️ Date

Saturday, 21st June 2025

📍 Location

Meeting Point: Usher Hall, Edinburgh
Time: Departure at 9:30 AM sharp

🥾 Hike Overview

  • Distance: ~19 km (loop)
  • Elevation Gain: ~1,100 meters
  • Difficulty: Moderate to Strenuous
  • Duration: 6–7 hours (including breaks)

🎒 What to Bring

  • Good hiking boots
  • Waterproof layers
  • Packed lunch and water
  • Sun protection
  • A positive spirit!

🚗 Travel

Carpooling options may be available. Please indicate in the sign-up form if you can offer or need a lift.

📝 Register

If you plan to attend, please contact us or fill out the Volunteer form and mention the event in the message.

We look forward to sharing the trail with you!
